message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. After careful consideration, I believe it would be fair to propose a price of $11000 for this exceptional item.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value of similar products.
Thank you for your interest, Bob. I understand your perspective and would like to propose a price of $10500 for the product. This is my best offer based on the value I place on it.

Thank you for your revised offer, Alice. I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $10500. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $9500. I hope we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob. Considering the value of the product and the discussions we've had, I am prepared to offer the product for $10000. I believe this is a fair compromise that respects both our positions.

I understand that you're trying to find a compromise, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to go up to $9200, but I think that's as high as I can go. I hope you can meet me halfway.

I appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement, Bob. I'm willing to consider your latest offer, but I must respectfully decline. I am unable to lower the price below $10000 due to the value I place on the product. I hope this aligns better with your budget.

I understand your position, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one final offer: $9000. If you're unable to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider purchasing the product from John for $12000.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm sorry I can't meet you at $9000, as it falls below my minimum acceptable price. I am unable to lower the price further. If you're still interested, I kindly ask that you reconsider the original offer of $10000. I'm hopeful we can reach a satisfactory conclusion.
